column1: Ixtapaluca is a city and a municipality in the eastern part of the State of Mexico in Mexico. It lies between the Federal District and the western border of the state of Puebla. The name Ixtapaluca means "Where the salt gets wet".As of 2006
column2: Izta included part of the world's largest mega-slum

column1: At the census of 2005 the city had a population of 290
column2: 076.The parish of Ixtapaluca was founded in 1531 and had great prominence in the area. The municipal palace was built in 1973.
the town of Ixtpaluca has governing jurisdiction over the following communities: Acozac
column13: Ejidos de Xalpa (Camino de los Alcanfores)

column1: The municipality had a population of 429
column2: 033 in 2005. The area of the municipality is 315.10 km² (121.66 sq mi). The municipality is part of the Mexico City metropolitan area. It is an important suburb because many people that work in Mexico City live in Ixtapaluca
column3: and it has developed recent commercial interest due to this. The first "fraccionamiento" or subdivision called San José de la Palma
column5: was built in 1989. The municipality is bordered by Chalco
column11: and the state of Puebla.The area was first settled in 1286 by the Mexicas. After the Spanish conquest
column12: in 1543 Ixtapaluca was given to the control of  Juan de Cuellar
column13: who continued the indigenous practice of demanding tribute every 80 days from the people.
